author: The UB Post
title: German President Gauck visits Mongolia
text:
Thursday, October 15th,   German President Gauck visits Mongolia 
By E.OYUNDARI 
President of the Federal Republic of Germany Joachim Gauck arrived in Ulaanbaatar with his spouse, Daniela Schadt, for a three-day state visit on October 14. He was welcomed by Minister of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia L.Purevsuren and other officials at Chinggis Khaan International Airport. An official welcoming ceremony for the German President was held at Chinggis Square yesterday. Gauck was welcomed by President of Mongolia Ts.Elbegdorj and his spouse, Kh.Bolormaa. Honor guards marched in formation and the state hymns of the two countries were played. Following the official ceremony, the counterparts paid tribute to the statue of Chinggis Khaan. President Gauck and Daniela Schadt signed the state’s honored guestbook and headed to the State Ceremonial Ger Palace to hold a meeting with President Ts.Elbegdorj. The visit coincides with the 25th anniversary of the first free, democratic election of Mongolia, as well as the 25th anniversary of the unification of East and West Germany. The Federal Republic of Germany has supported Mongolia’s democracy since its beginning and remains a major ally in Europe. The parties exchanged views on enhancing bilateral traditional relations and cooperation between the two countries. On the sidelines of the state visit, President Gauck will meet with Speaker Z.Enkhbold and Prime Minister Ch.Saikhanbileg to exchange views on bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries. President Gauck is also scheduled to visit the excavation site of the Mongolia-Germany Kharkhorin Expedition, as well as the German-Mongolian Institute for Resources and Technology.
